messages.content: Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of an airline, with tables for flights, reservations, passengers, luggage and pilot.

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model flight {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  code        String    @unique
  origin      String
  destination String
  date        DateTime
  bookings    booking[]
  pilots      pilot_flight[]
  @@index([destination, origin])
}

model booking {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  flight_id    Int
  passengerId Int
  seat        String
  class       String
  flight      flight    @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  passenger   passenger @relation(fields: [passengerId], references: [id])
  luggage     luggage[]
  @@index([passengerId])
}

model passenger {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email       String    @unique
  bookings    booking[]
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model luggage {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  bookingId   Int
  weight      Float
  description String
  booking     booking   @relation(fields: [bookingId], references: [id])
}

model pilot {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  license     String    @unique
  flights     pilot_flight[]   
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model pilot_flight {
  pilot_id     Int
  flight_id    Int
  pilot       pilot    @relation(fields: [pilot_id], references: [id])
  flight      flight   @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  @@id([pilot_id, flight_id])
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of an airline, with tables for flights, reservations, passengers, luggage and pilot.

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model flight {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  code        String    @unique
  origin      String
  destination String
  date        DateTime
  bookings    booking[]
  pilots      pilot_flight[]
  @@index([destination, origin])
}

model booking {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  flight_id    Int
  passengerId Int
  seat        String
  class       String
  flight      flight    @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  passenger   passenger @relation(fields: [passengerId], references: [id])
  luggage     luggage[]
  @@index([passengerId])
}

model passenger {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email       String    @unique
  bookings    booking[]
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model luggage {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  bookingId   Int
  weight      Float
  description String
  booking     booking   @relation(fields: [bookingId], references: [id])
}

model pilot {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  license     String    @unique
  flights     pilot_flight[]   
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model pilot_flight {
  pilot_id     Int
  flight_id    Int
  pilot       pilot    @relation(fields: [pilot_id], references: [id])
  flight      flight   @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  @@id([pilot_id, flight_id])
}"
add an index in booking seat and class and in luggage description

"
generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model flight {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  code        String    @unique
  origin      String
  destination String
  date        DateTime
  bookings    booking[]
  pilots      pilot_flight[]
  @@index([destination, origin])
}

model booking {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  flight_id   Int
  passengerId Int
  seat        String
  class       String
  flight      flight    @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  passenger   passenger @relation(fields: [passengerId], references: [id])
  luggage     luggage[]
  @@index([passengerId,seat, class])
}

model passenger {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email       String    @unique
  bookings    booking[]
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model luggage {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  bookingId   Int
  weight      Float
  description String
  booking     booking   @relation(fields: [bookingId], references: [id])
  @@index([description])
}

model pilot {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  license     String    @unique
  flights     pilot_flight[]   
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model pilot_flight {
  pilot_id     Int
  flight_id    Int
  pilot       pilot    @relation(fields: [pilot_id], references: [id])
  flight      flight   @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  @@id([pilot_id, flight_id])
}"

change the name of the table pilot to pilots

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model flight {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  code        String    @unique
  origin      String
  destination String
  date        DateTime
  bookings    booking[]
  pilots      pilot_flight[]
  @@index([destination, origin])
}

model booking {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  flight_id    Int
  passengerId Int
  seat        String
  class       String
  flight      flight    @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  passenger   passenger @relation(fields: [passengerId], references: [id])
  luggage     luggage[]
  @@index([passengerId])
}

model passenger {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email       String    @unique
  bookings    booking[]
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model luggage {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  bookingId   Int
  weight      Float
  description String
  booking     booking   @relation(fields: [bookingId], references: [id])
}

model pilots {
  id          Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name  String
  last_name   String
  license     String        @unique
  flights     pilot_flight[]   
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model pilot_flight {
  pilot_id    Int
  flight_id   Int
  pilot       pilots     @relation(fields: [pilot_id], references: [id])
  flight      flight     @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  @@id([pilot_id, flight_id])
}"

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model flight {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  code        String    @unique
  origin      String
  destination String
  date        DateTime
  bookings    booking[]
  pilots      pilot_flight[]
  @@index([destination, origin])
}

model booking {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  flight_id    Int
  passengerId Int
  seat        String
  class       String
  flight      flight    @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  passenger   passenger @relation(fields: [passengerId], references: [id])
  luggage     luggage?
  @@index([passengerId])
}

model passenger {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email       String    @unique
  bookings    booking[]
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model luggage {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  bookingId   Int       @unique
  weight      Float
  description String
  booking     booking   @relation(fields: [bookingId], references: [id])
}

model pilot {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  license     String    @unique
  flights     pilot_flight[]   
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model pilot_flight {
  pilot_id     Int
  flight_id    Int
  pilot       pilot    @relation(fields: [pilot_id], references: [id])
  flight      flight   @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  @@id([pilot_id, flight_id])
}
"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of an airline, with tables for flights, reservations, passengers, luggage and pilot.

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model flight {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  code        String    @unique
  origin      String
  destination String
  date        DateTime
  bookings    booking[]
  pilots      pilot_flight[]
  @@index([destination, origin])
}

model booking {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  flight_id    Int
  passengerId Int
  seat        String
  class       String
  flight      flight    @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  passenger   passenger @relation(fields: [passengerId], references: [id])
  luggage     luggage[]
  @@index([passengerId])
}

model passenger {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email       String    @unique
  bookings    booking[]
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model luggage {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  bookingId   Int
  weight      Float
  description String
  booking     booking   @relation(fields: [bookingId], references: [id])
}

model pilot {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  license     String    @unique
  flights     pilot_flight[]   
  @@index([first_name, last_name])
}

model pilot_flight {
  pilot_id     Int
  flight_id    Int
  pilot       pilot    @relation(fields: [pilot_id], references: [id])
  flight      flight   @relation(fields: [flight_id], references: [id])
  @@id([pilot_id, flight_id])
}"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Bank, with tables for Handling of accounts, transactions, and customer data.

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model customer {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  email     String    @unique
  phone     String?
  accounts  account[]
}

model account {
  id                  Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  customer_id          Int
  customer            customer      @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])
  type                String       
  balance             Float
  created_at           DateTime      @default(now())
  transactions_origin  transaction[] @relation("Origin")
  transactions_destiny transaction[] @relation("Destiny")
  branch_id            Int           
  branch              branch        @relation(fields: [branch_id], references: [id])
  loanId              Int
  loan                loan          @relation(fields: [loanId], references: [id])
}

model transaction {
  id              Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  account_origin_id Int
  account_destiny_id Int
  account_origin    account @relation(name: "Origin", fields: [account_origin_id], references: [id])
  account_destiny   account @relation(name: "Destiny", fields: [account_destiny_id], references: [id])
  amount           Float
  date             DateTime @default(now())
}

model employee {
  id       Int    @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  position String
  email    String @unique
  branch   branch @relation(fields: [branch_id], references: [id])
  branch_id Int
}

model branch {
  id       Int        @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  location String
  employees employee[]
  accounts  account[]
}

model loan {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  amount      Float
  interest_rate Float
  start_date   DateTime
  due_date     DateTime
  account     account[]
}
"

"generator client {

}

  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model participant {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  email     String    @unique
  tickets   ticket[]
  sessions  session[] @relation("sessionparticipants")
}

model session {
  id              Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  title           String
  star_time       DateTime
  end_time         DateTime
  speaker_id       Int
  speaker         speaker       @relation(fields: [speaker_id], references: [id])
  participants    participant[] @relation("sessionparticipants")
  event_id         Int           
  event           event         @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id]) 
}

model speaker {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  bio       String
  sessions  session[]
}

model ticket {
  id            Int         @id @default(autoincrement())
  type          String
  price         Float
  participant_id Int
  participant   participant @relation(fields: [participant_id], references: [id])
  event_id       Int
  event         event       @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id])
  @@index([participant_id, event_id])
}

model event {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  location  String
  date      DateTime
  tickets   ticket[]
  sessions  session[]
  logistics logistics[]
  @@index([name, location, date])
}

model logistics {
  id          Int     @id @default(autoincrement())
  description String
  event_id     Int
  event       event   @relation(fields: [event_id], references: [id])
}

}

model ticket {

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Government with tables for civil records, identification documents, and electoral management

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model civil_record {
  id                  Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  person_id           Int                @unique
  birth_certificate   String             @unique
  marriage_certificate String?           
  death_certificate   String?            
  person              person             @relation(fields: [person_id], references: [id])
  @@index([person_id])
}

model identity_document {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  person_id         Int                @unique
  passport_number   String             @unique
  national_id       String             @unique
  driver_license    String?            
  person            person             @relation(fields: [person_id], references: [id])
  @@index([person_id])
}

model electoral_management {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  person_id         Int                @unique
  voter_id          String             @unique
  election_name     String
  has_voted         Boolean            @default(false)
  person            person             @relation(fields: [person_id], references: [id])
  @@index([person_id])
}

model person {
  id                    Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  identification_number String             @unique
  first_name            String
  last_name             String
  date_of_birth         DateTime
  civil_record          civil_record?
  identity_document     identity_document?
  electoral_management  electoral_management?
}"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Hotel with tables for reservations, rooms, services, and hotel managers

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model hotel {
  id            Int            @id @default(autoincrement())
  name          String         @unique
  address       String
  rooms         room[]
  services      service[]
  reservations  reservation[]
  hotel_manager hotel_manager?
}

model room {
  id        Int         @id @default(autoincrement())
  number    String      @unique
  capacity  Int
  hotel_id  Int
  hotel     hotel       @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
  bookings  reservation[]
}

model service {
  id       Int    @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  price    Float
  hotel_id Int
  hotel    hotel  @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
}

model reservation {
  id         Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  start_date DateTime
  end_date   DateTime
  guest_name String
  room_id    Int
  room       room      @relation(fields: [room_id], references: [id])
  hotel_id   Int
  hotel      hotel     @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
  @@index([guest_name, hotel_id,room_id])
}

model hotel_manager {
  id       Int    @id @default(autoincrement())
  name     String
  ubication String
  country String
  hotel_id Int    @unique
  hotel    hotel  @relation(fields: [hotel_id], references: [id])
}"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of park with tables for amusement_park, entry, attraction, client, maintenance_log

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model amusement_park {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String             @unique
  location          String
  entries           entry[]
  attractions       attraction[]
  clients           client[]
}

model entry {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  date              DateTime
  client_id         Int
  client            client             @relation(fields: [client_id], references: [id])
  ticket_type       String
  amusement_park_id Int                // Add this line
  amusement_park    amusement_park     @relation(fields: [amusement_park_id], references: [id])  // And this line
}

model attraction {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String             @unique
  type              String
  status            String
  maintenance_logs  maintenance_log[]
  amusement_park_id Int                // Add this line
  amusement_park    amusement_park     @relation(fields: [amusement_park_id], references: [id])  // And this line
}

model client {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String
  email             String             @unique
  phone_number      String             @unique
  entries           entry[]
  maintenance_logs  maintenance_log[]
  amusement_park_id Int?               // Add this line
  amusement_park    amusement_park?    @relation(fields: [amusement_park_id], references: [id])  // And this line
}

model maintenance_log {
  id                Int                @id @default(autoincrement())
  date              DateTime
  description       String
  attraction_id     Int
  attraction        attraction         @relation(fields: [attraction_id], references: [id])
  client_id         Int
  client            client             @relation(fields: [client_id], references: [id])
}"

}

model store {

  products    product[]
  customers   customer[]
}

model product {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  name        String
  price       Float
  stock       Int
  store_id    Int
  store       store    @relation(fields: [store_id], references: [id])
  categories  category[]
  purchases   purchase[]
}

model customer {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  name        String
  email       String   @unique
  phone       String?
  store_id    Int
  store       store    @relation(fields: [store_id], references: [id])
  purchases   purchase[]
}

model category {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  name        String   @unique
  product_id  Int
  product     product  @relation(fields: [product_id], references: [id])
}

model purchase {

  date        DateTime

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of real estate agency with tables for real_estate_agency, property, client, lease_contract

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model real_estate_agency {
  id            Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  name          String          @unique
  properties    property[]
  clients       client[]
  lease_contracts lease_contract[]
}

model property {
  id            Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  address       String          @unique
  description   String
  price         Float
  agency_id     Int
  real_estate_agency real_estate_agency @relation(fields: [agency_id], references: [id])
  lease_contracts lease_contract[]
  @@index([address, description, price])
}

model client {
  id            Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  name          String
  email         String          @unique
  phone_number  String          @unique
  real_estate_agency_id Int
  real_estate_agency real_estate_agency @relation(fields: [real_estate_agency_id], references: [id])
  lease_contracts lease_contract[]
}

model lease_contract {
  id            Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  start_date    DateTime
  end_date      DateTime
  property_id   Int
  client_id     Int
  real_estate_agency_id Int
  property      property        @relation(fields: [property_id], references: [id])
  client        client          @relation(fields: [client_id], references: [id])
  real_estate_agency real_estate_agency @relation(fields: [real_estate_agency_id], references: [id])
  @@index([property_id, client_id, real_estate_agency_id])
}

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of research center with tables for research_center, experiment, publication, collaboration and partner

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model research_center {
  id              Int               @id @default(autoincrement())
  name            String            @unique
  location        String
  experiments     experiment[]      
  publications    publication[]     
  collaborations  collaboration[]   
}

model experiment {
  id                Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  title             String
  date_conducted    DateTime
  result            String
  research_center_id Int            @unique
  research_center   research_center @relation(fields: [research_center_id], references: [id])
  publications      publication[]   
}

model publication {
  id                Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  title             String          @unique
  published_date    DateTime
  research_center_id Int
  research_center   research_center @relation(fields: [research_center_id], references: [id])
  
  experiments       experiment[]    
}

model collaboration {
  id                Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String
  start_date        DateTime
  end_date          DateTime?
  research_center_id Int
  research_center   research_center @relation(fields: [research_center_id], references: [id])
  partners          partner[]       
}

model partner {
  id                Int             @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String          @unique
  collaboration_id  Int
  collaboration     collaboration   @relation(fields: [collaboration_id], references: [id])
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of restaurant with tables for restaurant, reservation, menu, menu_item, order and order_item

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model restaurant {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  name        String   @unique
  address     String
  reservations reservation[]
  menus       menu[]
  orders      order[]
}

model reservation {
  id            Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  datetime      DateTime
  customer_name String
  restaurant_id Int
  restaurant    restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])
  @@index([datetime, customer_name])
}

model menu {
  id            Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  title         String
  description   String?
  items         menu_item[]
  restaurant_id Int
  restaurant    restaurant @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])
}

model menu_item {
  id        Int    @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  price     Float
  menu_id   Int
  menu      menu   @relation(fields: [menu_id], references: [id])
  orders    order_item[]
  @@index([name])
}

model order {
  id            Int         @id @default(autoincrement())
  status        String
  total_price   Float
  created_at    DateTime    @default(now())
  restaurant_id Int
  restaurant    restaurant  @relation(fields: [restaurant_id], references: [id])
  items         order_item[]
}

model order_item {
  id        Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  quantity  Int
  item_id   Int
  order_id  Int
  item      menu_item @relation(fields: [item_id], references: [id])
  order     order    @relation(fields: [order_id], references: [id])
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of Schools with tables for Student information, grades, Subjects, Courses and class schedules
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of social network with tables for social_network, user, post, comment, like and friendship

"
generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model social_network {
  id        Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String   @unique
  users     user[]
}

model user {
  id              Int         @id @default(autoincrement())
  username        String      @unique
  email           String      @unique
  social_network_id Int
  social_network  social_network @relation(fields: [social_network_id], references: [id])
  posts           post[]
  comments        comment[]
  likes           like[]
  friendships     friendship[] @relation("user_friendships")
  friend_of       friendship[] @relation("friend_friendships")
  @@index([username, email])
}

model post {
  id        Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  title     String
  content   String
  user_id   Int
  user      user     @relation(fields: [user_id], references: [id])
  comments  comment[]
  likes     like[]
  @@index([title, content])
}

model comment {
  id        Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  content   String
  user_id   Int
  user      user     @relation(fields: [user_id], references: [id])
  post_id   Int
  post      post     @relation(fields: [post_id], references: [id])
}

model like {
  id        Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  user_id   Int
  user      user     @relation(fields: [user_id], references: [id])
  post_id   Int
  post      post     @relation(fields: [post_id], references: [id])
}

model friendship {
  id          Int      @id @default(autoincrement())
  user_id     Int
  friend_id   Int
  user        user     @relation(name: "user_friendships", fields: [user_id], references: [id])
  friend      user     @relation(name: "friend_friendships", fields: [friend_id], references: [id])
  @@unique([user_id, friend_id])
}"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of telecommunication services with tables for customers, service plans, billing info, and service usage

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model customer {
  id                Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String
  email             String    @unique
  phone_number      String    @unique
  billing_address   String
  accounts          account[]
}

model account {
  id                Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  customer_id       Int
  service_plan_id   Int
  billing_info      billing_info[]
  service_usage     service_usage[]
  customer          customer   @relation(fields: [customer_id], references: [id])
  service_plan      service_plan @relation(fields: [service_plan_id], references: [id])
  @@index([customer_id])
}

model service_plan {
  id                Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name              String
  description       String
  price             Float
  accounts          account[]
}

model billing_info {
  id                Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  account_id        Int
  billing_date      DateTime
  amount_due        Float
  payment_status    String
  account           account   @relation(fields: [account_id], references: [id])
  @@index([billing_date, payment_status])
}

model service_usage {
  id                Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  account_id        Int
  date_used         DateTime
  data_consumed     Float    
  minutes_used      Int    
  messages_sent     Int    
  account           account   @relation(fields: [account_id], references: [id])
}"

Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of travel agency with tables for agencies, packages, clients, reservations, and bookings

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model agency {
  id            Int            @id @default(autoincrement())
  name          String         @unique
  email         String         @unique
  phone         String?
  packages      package_[]
  reservations  reservation[]
}

model package_ {
  id          Int          @id @default(autoincrement())
  name        String
  description String
  price       Float
  duration    Int          
  agency_id   Int
  agency      agency       @relation(fields: [agency_id], references: [id])
  bookings    booking[]
}

model client {
  id           Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  first_name   String
  last_name    String
  email        String        @unique
  phone        String?
  reservations reservation[]
}

model reservation {
  id         Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  date       DateTime
  client_id  Int
  client     client    @relation(fields: [client_id], references: [id])
  booking_id Int
  booking    booking   @relation(fields: [booking_id], references: [id])
  agency_id  Int
  agency     agency    @relation(fields: [agency_id], references: [id])
}

model booking {
  id         Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  date       DateTime
  package_id Int
  package    package_  @relation(fields: [package_id], references: [id])
  guests     Int
  reservations reservation[]
}"
Give me a prisma schema for a relational database of veterinary services with tables for pets, owners, vets, appointments, and medical histories

"generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model owner {
  id        Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  email     String    @unique
  phone     String?
  pets      pet[]
}

model pet {
  id            Int              @id @default(autoincrement())
  name          String
  species       String
  breed         String?
  birth_date    DateTime?
  owner_id      Int
  owner         owner            @relation(fields: [owner_id], references: [id])
  appointments  appointment[]
  medical_records medical_record[]
}

model vet {
  id        Int           @id @default(autoincrement())
  name      String
  email     String        @unique
  phone     String?
  appointments appointment[]
}

model appointment {
  id          Int          @id @default(autoincrement())
  date        DateTime
  pet_id      Int
  pet         pet          @relation(fields: [pet_id], references: [id])
  vet_id      Int
  vet         vet          @relation(fields: [vet_id], references: [id])
  description String?
}

model medical_record {
  id          Int       @id @default(autoincrement())
  pet_id      Int
  pet         pet       @relation(fields: [pet_id], references: [id])
  record_date DateTime
  details     String
}"
